title: The Circle’s Sammie finally revealed as catfish James in tense meet-up
text:
Sammie came face-to-face with the Circlers in the final (Picture: Channel 4)

The Circle was thrown into chaos, as catfish ‘Sammie’ – who is really James – finally came face-to-face with the other players.

And it was seriously intense.

After the final ratings had taken place, Circlers ‘Sammie’, Georgina, Paddy, Tim and Woody were given an alert, explaining they were going to meet face-to-face for the first time.

Single mum Sammie – who is really not single, not mum James – was first in the room, ready to meet those he had been catfishing for three weeks.

‘I am quite nervous,’ he said as he paced around the room, giving himself a pep-talk.

Tim was the first to join ‘Sammie’ in the room, and was positively shook when he realised what had been going down.

‘Sammie’ unveiled himself as James (Picture: Channel 4)

Tim was shook (Picture: Channel 4)

‘You’re a very naughty boy,’ he told James after learning the truth, before asking all the questions.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘What about Charlie? Are you Charlie? The Sammie we saw really exists?’

A sheepish James replied: ‘I don’t know the girl…

‘The reason I went as a single mum is, I thought, “Who do I adore more than anyone in the world?” and it’s my mum. She raised me on my own.

Georgina couldn’t deal with the news (Picture: Channel 4)

Paddy was speechless by the whole thing (Picture: Channel 4)

‘I did it for all the right reasons. If my mum never had to worry about another bill, that’s everything to me. I thought this character resonated with her really well.’

The rest of the Circlers came in soon after and laughed off the fact they were all catfished, instead more shocked that Woody was actually real.

It was actually Ella, who had been blocked in last night’s episode, that had the biggest reaction to Sammie’s real identity.

Emma Willis dropped the bombshell live at the finale, showing her a video of the catfish in action, plotting to take her down.

Everyone was more baffled by Woody being real (Picture: Channel 4)

Ella’s expression was the best (Picture: Channel 4)

‘I had a feeling it was that f**ker,’ she yelled. ‘Does he even have a kid?’

‘He’s such an immoral little s**t! Oh my God, I fell for it hook, line and sinker!’

You’re not the only one, hun…

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I’m such a moron because I do have little inklings…,’ she added to Emma, before insisting: ‘There isn’t any [bad blood].’

We’re already living for the next series.

Got a showbiz story? If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.

description: The Circle was thrown into chaos, as catfish ‘Sammie’ – who is really James - finally came face-to-face with the other players.
